DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this trial is to clarify the impact of lactobacillus preparation on the incidence of diarrhea in ICU-admitted patients. Almost all patients in ICU are treated with antibiotics for the effective control of various infections. However, antibiotics-associated diarrhea is another matter of concern. Many previous studies were proved that the use of probiotic lactobacillus preparation can reduce antibiotics-associated diarrhea in ward-admitted patients. In this study, we are planning to perform a similar study in severely ill patients in ICU.
DOC.brief_title: Lactobacillus Preparation on the Incidence of Diarrhea
DOC.criteria: All patients admitted in intensive care unit Age more than 19 Diarrhea occurence within 1 week of ICU admission Recent history of probiotics use (within 1 month) GI obstruction History of abnormal symptoms and sign for the probiotics use (rash, edema, sepsis, etc.) immunocompromized patients
